body.p: A framework configuration provides validation, content completion and visual editing support for a certain XML vocabulary.

Usually a framework customization provides a schema used to validate and edit certain type of XML documents, a CSS used to edit the XML documents in the Author visual editing mode and various custom actions or behaviors used to enhance the editing experience.

Oxygen comes out of the box with a lot of framework configuration folders (OXYGEN_INSTALL_DIR/frameworks) to support editing XML documents of various types like DocBook, DITA, XHTML or TEI. All these existing framework configurations can be further configured in the Oxygen Preferences->Document Type Associations page. These framework configurations can be used as examples for building your own support for a certain XML vocabulary or they can be extended if you want to share with others a modified version of a framework bundled with Oxygen.
The Document Type Association Edit dialog allows you to configure all the framework specific settings.
